departmentDescription: The Interdisciplinary Major in Neuroscience at Rhodes bridges the fields of Biology, Psychology, Chemistry, and Philosophy. The major provides students with an understanding of the methodological challenges and conceptual issues that lie at the heart of efforts to understand the function of the nervous system and its role in behavior.

requirements: GPA: Maintaining a cumulative and major GPA of at least 3.5
Must take Neuroscience 399 (Spring of junior year) and Up to 8 credits of Neuroscience 495-496 each semester of senior year

Submit a proposal for an independent research project for approval by the Program Committee by the start of the senior year. A written report and oral presentation at the conclusion of the research project are required. The honors degree in Neuroscience is contingent upon committee acceptance of the research manuscript.
